intro: Matelea altatensis, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related genera. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and arranged alternately along the stems. Matelea altatensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded, humid environments.
